page.title: 05ECOLOGY
page.content: ECOLOGY STANTON HARCOURT After gravel was extracted from Vicarage Pit Buckingshamshire, Berkshire and Oxfordshire Naturalists Trust (BBONT) bought the land and made it into a{nature reserve. }Visitors are discouraged. {FOOTPATHS}A lot of work has been done by the Parish Council and villagers to open footpaths around the village. Some local farmers had ploughed, planted and fenced over them and they were impassable. Those open are 3, 4, 7, 8 the Bridleway has always been open. Much work to the north of the village is needed but the farmer is intransigent. {CLIMATE}Mild, predominantly SW winds 1984 summer was very wet. Snow rare, but in 1984 village cut off for a day. Hedge removal by farmers one cause of drifting snow.
